results.title: Debating Techniques
results.brief_description: In this program, the formal rules and techniques of Debating are presented in detail. Middle School students are involved in a debate, providing a real context for the presentation of the techniques. The Debate, its format, the role of each team and of each member of the team, are explained and demonstrated. Adjudication of the Debate is included.

results.title: Death Star Canteen
results.brief_description: A young American YouTuber animated this stop-motion film to Eddie Izzard’s “Death Star Canteen” comedy bit from Circle.

constellations_other.name: Stop-motion fantasies
constellations_other.description: The LEGO Movie draws on fan-made stop-motion films for its aesthetic style, but fantastical animation comes in many forms.

results.title: Death railway (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Death Railway, portrays the heroism and solidarity of the Australian troops during World War 11. Using scenes of the railway today, authentic archival footage from Australian and Japanese sources, the drawings of Sir Edward Dunlop, and present day interviews, the film covers the route the railway took up the Kwai Noi Valley, between Rangoon and Bangkok. 116,000 Australians, British and Dutch lost their lives building the railway.

results.title: Death railway
results.creator_credit: David Bilcock and Bilcock and Copping Film Productions
results.brief_description: Examines the building of the 280 mile long narrow gauge Bangkok to Rangoon Railway during the 1940’s, on which 116,000 World War II prisoners died. A number of POW’s, including Dr ‘Weary’ Dunlop who worked on the railway and survived provide valuable reminiscences of the hardships endured, meagre food rations, lack of medical facilities, the use of a wood saw to amputate limbs and tropical ulcers. The relics of a nightmare railway line are still visible in remote reaches of Thailand’s jungle. David Bilcock and his film crew retrace the steps of the soldiers who perished building the line that was to be bombed during its first week of operation. Includes footage of the Japanese attack on Malaya and Singapore and the setting up of Changi Prison. Narrated by Gerrard Kennedy. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Death of a student
results.creator_credit: Brian Armstrong and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: Compiled from footage shot surreptitiously by Granada Television’s World in Action Unit and an underground Czech filmmaker. Records the events that were taking place on the streets of Prague following the death of 21 year old Jan Palach, the first Czech student who set himself alight as a protest against censorship and Soviet occupation of his country. From his deathbed, he sent a message to his compatriots hoping to rouse them into action against their oppressors. He died on the 19th of January 1969, 73 hours after setting himself on fire. The film documents the street vigils occuring while Palach was in hospital, the demonstration organised the day after his death and the tributes and ceremonies that marked his funeral which was attended by half a million people. A musical lament interspersed with the sound of Soviet tanks was composed for Palach’s death and edited with footage of his funeral. Includes vox populi interviews and a visit by the film unit to Palach’s philosophy class at Prague University. Cinematography for Granada Television by Ian McFarlane. Edited by Gerry Dow, Jeremy Wallington and Leslies Woodhead.

results.title: Dear God in heaven
results.creator_credit: Ian Fowler, Rufus Guds and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Heaven rests precariously upon the ozone layer. When a suburban family habitually uses fluorocarbon propelled aerosols the direct result is the loss of God’s personal TV When the situation worsens he calls for the aid of Jesus and the apostles. Cast includes Ted Venn, Evonne Shields, Nigel Buesst, Jan Marnell.

results.title: Dealing with office fires [rev.ed]
results.brief_description: This video looks at immediate response to fires which may occur in the office environment. It shows the correct use of different types of fire extinguishers with their distinct ASA labels, and fixed hose reels. Contains useful advice on personal safety issues, evacuation procedures and maintenance of fire equipment.

results.title: Dealing with office fires
results.brief_description: This program shows office staff how fires can be extinguished when you know what to do. It features the water hose reel and three extinguishers commonly used on infant fires. The safety of all people, informing the fire brigade, possibly evacuation and attacking the fire are all dealt with. This will give staff confidence to act appropriately and will show how simple it is to pull the pin and squeeze the lever.

results.title: Dealing with difficult people
results.brief_description: The aim of this video-based training program is to inform participants about four fundamental techniques which will enable them to deal with difficult people. The techniques can be applied to everyday contexts within the home and workplace. A video which complements the manual can be borrowed as a separate loan item.

results.title: Dealing with death
results.creator_credit: Perry Schwartz, Filmmakers and Motorola Teleprograms
results.brief_description: Looks at the problems of stress which face police officers, focusing on the effect of confrontation with death. Presents realistic examples of police officers reacting to stress. A useful tool in helping students to anticipate the effects of stress and to counteract them.
